[Readable](https://github.com/haliliceylan/rfcs/blob/project-toml-converter/text/0000-project-toml-converter.md)

Hello everyone, 

This is my first RFC as a GSOC Mentee at this summer. We prepared this RFC with @natalieparellano. We spent some time in my own fork to get ready this RFC. You can access previous comment and feedbacks from [here](https://github.com/haliliceylan/rfcs/pull/2).
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 701369775, 'comment_body': "What operators are we talking about here? I have the sense that this should say platform implementers. If that is so then I have a predicament with this  statement. Only a subset of the `project.toml` wouldn't be translated due to the fact that the spec allows for undefined keys/tables. It seems like platforms may very well still have to care about the initial input format to some degree.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 19, 37, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 701372739, 'comment_body': 'what happens to overlapped properties? ie. translating the following from `v0.2` to `v0.1`:

```toml
[_]
name = "My App"

# in this schema version this is consider arbitrary/user data
[project]
name = "Client 2 Project"
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 19, 43, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 701373356, 'comment_body': 'If I recall correctly, arbitrary data would be retained. Could we get an example of a 1-to-1 real complex example to get a better understanding on how the translation would work?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 19, 44, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 703518044, 'comment_body': '@jkutner @hone, do you have any good examples for that ?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 7, 13, 37, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'haliliceylan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 704577654, 'comment_body': 'We should call out explicitly that we only intend to "translate" data under `_` and `io.buildpacks`. Then there is the question of what to do with data under other domains - I believe that 
* the original project.toml in 0.2 schema
* a separate file for "other" stuff
* a separate file for each domain - but this would be hard because we wouldn't know which `.` to split on

were all discussed. I don't think there is much substantive difference between the first two, and my preference is for the first one for its simplicity.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 8, 16, 20, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 704579339, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
- This feature has similarities with the "prepare" phase that has been discussed previously (see #555). But it is much smaller in scope. Potentially, the binary described in this RFC could eventually take on more responsibilities and look more like "prepare". But that is out of scope for this RFC. If the binary were to eventually take on more responsibility, all of its functions should be easily turned on and off, so that platform operators could choose which functionality to expose to users.  
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 8, 16, 22, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 704581758, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The Project TOML Converter is a CLI tool that will ship alongside the lifecycle. It has only one responsibility at this time, to support conversion between schemas. The tool will not need to be executed in a containerized environment (similar to `rebase`). Though it can be invoked as a separate binary it may end up being part of the lifecycle which itself is a multi-call binary (see https://github.com/buildpacks/rfcs/blob/main/text/0024-lifecycle-multicall-binary-for-build.md). 
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 8, 16, 25, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 708486043, 'comment_body': 'maybe we can add a global prefix or postfix for keys which not included this list ? (just an idea)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 14, 17, 28, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'haliliceylan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 720485842, 'comment_body': '@jromero is this what you had in mind? https://github.com/buildpacks/rfcs/pull/182/files#diff-d6828a110979d409ba620d1b80593932c1cea332756b3cc7f7c14922dfc0b16aR132-R133', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 1, 19, 16, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 720487298, 'comment_body': "5c2075d should help clarify the mapping from 0.1 <-> 0.2 ...though I wasn't sure what to do about `[build.buildpacks.script]`. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 1, 19, 19, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 720487462, 'comment_body': 'https://github.com/buildpacks/rfcs/commit/5c2075de14bd73f6a972e4b6441c8de9b1b57ae6 may help', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 10, 1, 19, 19, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'natalieparellano', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 758609147, 'comment_body': "IIRC, we were going to ignore (not map) previously non-existent properties. It doesn't make sense for platforms to expect properties that aren't associated with their specification.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 11, 29, 18, 0, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}]
